intro: Caesulia radicans, commonly known as the trailing caesulia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces clusters of small, pale pink to white flowers. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, giving them a soft texture.
